Make a list of concepts a user has to understand to be able to do these activities and understand the resources.

1. Basic features of styles in Word, including character styles and paragraph styles.
2. Benefits of using styles in Word documents, including consistency and accessibility.
3. Creating new styles in Word and customizing default styles.
4. Creating an accessible PDF from a Word document using styles.
5. Evaluating the use of styles in a Word document for accessibility and structure.
6. Designing and implementing a set of styles to improve the accessibility and structure of a Word document.
7. Understanding how to use the self-assessment quiz to test understanding of the concepts learned.
8. Familiarity with using Microsoft Word, including creating and editing Word documents.
9. Ability to access and watch video tutorials and read articles on the internet.
10. Basic computer skills, such as using a laptop or computer, and opening and saving files.

This list covers the key concepts a user must understand to successfully complete the activities and utilize the resources. Understanding these concepts is crucial for achieving the learning objectives in the 4-week self-study program.

I need a table of key term with their definitions.

| Key Term | Definition |
| --- | --- |
| Styles | A set of formatting options in Microsoft Word that can be applied consistently to text and paragraphs. |
| Accessible PDF | A PDF document that is optimized for accessibility, making it easy for people with disabilities to read and understand the content. |
| Character styles | Styles in Microsoft Word that can be applied to individual characters or groups of characters within a paragraph. |
| Paragraph styles | Styles in Microsoft Word that can be applied to entire paragraphs of text. |
| Customizing default styles | Modifying the default styles in Microsoft Word to better suit the specific needs of a document or user. |
| Creating new styles | Defining and saving new styles in Microsoft Word to be used in a document. |
| Evaluating accessibility | Checking a Word document for compliance with accessibility standards, including font size, color contrast, and alternative text for images. |
| Keyboard shortcuts | Keyboard combinations that can be used to quickly apply styles in Word without using the mouse. |
| Formatting options | Tools and features in Microsoft Word that can be used to improve the structure and organization of a document. |
| Consistency | The use of a consistent set of styles in a Word document to maintain a professional and organized appearance. |
